citation.article-title: Isolation, cultivation and characteristics of Macromonas bipunctata

p.s: Description of Macromonas bipunctata sp. nov. (Gicklhorn) Utermohl and Koppe 1924

Cells are single or in pairs, pear shaped, cylindrical, or of a curved form, 2.2-4.0 x 3.3-6.5 μ in size. They move by means of a bundle of twined cilia, which may be seen in a light microscope. They are gram-negative. Colonies are nonpigmented, slightly opalescent, flat on the surface of the medium, measuring 0.5-4.00 mm; in the depth of the agar, they form tetrahedrals measuring 0.3-1.0 mm.
Physiology: They are strict aerobes, optimum temperature is 28°; growth is weak at 15 and 37°C; pH limits for growth are 6.0-9.0, optimum pH is 7.5-8.2.
Chemoorganoheterotrophy.
For growth, the cells use a limited number of substrates, mainly organic acids: acetate, succinate, malate, fumarate, oxaloacetate, pyruvate, and benzoate..
Ability to use oxalate, lactate, α-ketoglutarate, aconitate, glyocylate, and ethanol varies 1n the different strains.
They are capable of growing on casein hydrolysate and yeast extract.
Sugars, alcohols, and amino acids are not used.
Vitamins are required for growth.
They use ammonia salts, glutamate, casein, hydrolysate, and peptone as sources of nitrogen; some strains use cysteine, cystine, alanine, and serine.
Nitrates are not reduced to nitrites.
Casein and starch are not hydrolyzed; nitrites, sulfates, thiosulfate, and fumarate are not used as electron acceptors.
They have urease and catalase activity.
They do not form hydrogen sulfide from cysteine and thiosulfate in the medium.
They do not form indole.
Elemental sulfur is accumulated within the cells on a medium with sulfides but not with thiosulfate.
GTs is 67.3-68.3 mole %.
Source: precipitates of effluents from aerotanks.
Typical Strain D-405.
This strain was isolated from precipitates in sewage equipment.

Its description agrees with the species description with the following specifications: In addition to the listed substrate sources, it uses α-ketoglutarate, lactate, ethanol, glyocylate, propionate, and oxylate; of the amino acids, it uses aspartate, alanine, and serine as sources of nitrogen.
GTs content is 67.6 mole %.
The strains is registered as No. 1366 in the All-Union Collection of Microorganisms at the Institute of Biophysics of Microorganisms of the Academy of Sciences of the USSR.
